Articles.Content:
I need the 3d model of a kerbal, preferably in blender. How can I achive this? Or does anyone have (or have seen) a model?

The reason is, I want to make a papercraft kerbal, but I need something to work with and a newly modeled kerbal from me would probably not turn out well.

Preferable a less detailed version (maybe the cocpit kerbals are less detailed than the ones from the menue screen?).

well, before the forums get set back so far, vladoportos made a 3D kerbal model and had it up for download, it's low detail, but you can improve on it.

I made a version of it that has fingers, http://www./?922nag09zd4o7l1 you can import it into blender as an OBJ file

EDIT: it doesn't come with armatures or shape keys. so you'll have to set some up.

You could use Miaxmo to give it armature, something I'm working on now.

Edit: This model has no textures for me(?)

Edit 2: Heres a rendered model, comes in T-Pose, I just have no idea what a FBX file is. https://www.dropbox.com/s/pzkxiij5ppwc1jr/untitled.fbx

Edited May 8, 2013 by Cooly568

You could use Miaxmo to give it armature, something I'm working on now.

Edit: This model has no textures for me(?)

Edit 2: Heres a rendered model, comes in T-Pose, I just have no idea what a FBX file is. https://www.dropbox.com/s/pzkxiij5ppwc1jr/untitled.fbx

Yeah... it's kind of meant to be used in blender... or somthing similar,

You could use Miaxmo to give it armature, something I'm working on now.

Edit: This model has no textures for me(?)

Edit 2: Heres a rendered model, comes in T-Pose, I just have no idea what a FBX file is. https://www.dropbox.com/s/pzkxiij5ppwc1jr/untitled.fbx

FBX is a 3D Studio / Autodesk format, it's pretty much what most of us use to export from blender or 3dsmax into Unity.
Is it to scale? Or will I have to scale it up or down.

Is it to scale? Or will I have to scale it up or down.

I'm thinking it's not. but if you look at the wiki, you can make him the correct height.
